titleStmt.title: Clavis ad portam, or a key fitted to open the gate of tongues Wherein you may readily finde the Latine and French for any English word necessary for all young schollers.
titleStmt.author: Saltonstall, Wye, fl. 1630-1640.

notesStmt.note: Issued as an index to, and often bound together with, STC 15079, "Porta linguarum trilinguis reserata", a version of "Janua linguarum reserata" by Johann Amos Comenius.
Some leaves tightly bound. Signatures F5-end from Bodleian Library spliced at end.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
